content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

The target structure consists of two main components: 
1. A smaller structure on the left (a tower with a circular opening)
2. A larger structure on the right (resembling a building with arches and towers)

### Block Count and Layers:
- Total blocks used: Approximately 15 blocks
- The structures have multiple layers (base, middle, and top layers)

### Spatial Relationships:
The left structure has:
- A red base block with a circular hole
- Yellow cylindrical/semi-circular blocks on top
- An orange triangular roof block

The right structure has:
- A red base with multiple arch openings
- An orange cylindrical tower in the middle
- Yellow rectangular blocks forming walls
- A green rectangular block on the right side
- An orange triangular roof on top of the tower

## Required Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on my analysis, the following blocks are needed:

For the left structure:
- Block 3 (red block with circular opening)
- Block 12 (yellow semi-circular block) - used twice
- Block 15 (orange triangular roof)

For the right structure:
- Block 1 (red block with arch) - used once
- Block 2 (red block with arch) - used once
- Block 5 (red block with arch) - used once
- Block 6 (green vertical rectangular block)
- Block 10 (yellow vertical rectangular block) - used twice
- Block 11 (orange cylindrical tower)
- Block 8 or 9 (yellow horizontal rectangular block) - used once
- Block 15 (orange triangular roof)

## Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 3
    Step2: Move block with index 12
    Step3: Move block with index 12 
    Step4: Move block with index 15
    Step5: Move block with index 1
    Step6: Move block with index 2
    Step7: Move block with index 5
    Step8: Move block with index 11
    Step9: Move block with index 10
    Step10: Move block with index 10
    Step11: Move block with index 8
    Step12: Move block with index 6
    Step13: Move block with index 15
}
```

This assembly order first creates the left tower structure, and then proceeds to build the right, larger structure from the base up to the roof.
